channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Retail Is Fashionable With Investors Again, But Only the Unflashy Kind
item.description: More people than ever are running errands at their neighborhood shopping center. Supply of this type of property is surprisingly scarce.

item.title: Nazi Ties to Credit Suisse Ran Deeper Than Was Known, Hidden Files Reveal
item.description: Fresh look at archives unearthed Nazi-linked accounts discovered by bank in 1990s but never disclosed to investigators.

item.title: Rivian stock has its best day ever after EV maker reports 2024 production, deliveries
item.description: Rivian on Friday said it produced 49,476 electric vehicles last year.

item.title: Darden Restaurants stock climbs as Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse fuel sales growth
item.description: Darden Restaurants met Wall Street's expectations for its fiscal second-quarter results.

item.title: Tesla reports first-ever drop in annual deliveries
item.description: Tesla's fourth-quarter deliveries report follows a huge late-year rally in the stock that lifted its gain for 2024 to 63%.

item.title: Here is our third-quarter earnings report card for 33 stocks in the portfolio
item.description: We ranked the quarterly reports of our holdings in the Club as great, good, not-so-bad and ugly.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.2% To 102.99
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.2% to 102.99 â€” snapping a three-trading-day winning streak.

item.title: The Secret to Staying on Budget: Set Aside Money for Splurging
item.description: I keep a tight rein on my spending throughout the year. But for my birthday, I focus on what I want, not just what I need.

item.title: One Man's Attempt to Get a Perfect 850 Credit Score
item.description: The grade of financial health, once a figure tucked away on loan applications, has become an everyday obsession for more Americans.

item.title: Nike CEO Elliott Hill outlines new strategy after retailer blames promotions for declining revenue and profit
item.description: Nike beat Wall Street's expectations on the top and bottom lines under new CEO Elliott Hill.
